page.title: 03The Canal
page.content: The canal was built because a) Chelmsford was the main market town of the area and the canal provided a cheap, quick way to export the main produce of the locality (mainly cereal crops) to other parts of the country. b) Similarly, Chelmsford needed commodities such as coal and timber. c) The roads were in a dreadful condition and goods took too long and were too expensive to transport in this way. d) Imports were previously unloaded at Maldon who imposed taxes which further increased the price of goods. The effects of the canal include :- Chelmsford became richer, Maldon poorer; Heybridge Basin was established and Heybridge grew in size and became more cosmpolitan;{Bentall's moved to Heybridge changing it from a farming village to an industrial one.
